message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about amoebas, microscopic unicellular organisms. Amoebas are solitary organisms, meaning they exist individually and do not make friends, have multiple uses, or work together with other organisms. Option (A) is incorrect because amoebas do not have the ability to make friends. Option (B) is incorrect because amoebas have specific functions within their own individual bodies. Option (C) is incorrect because amoebas do not work together with other organisms.

This question requires knowledge about the characteristics of amoebas. An amoeba is a single-celled organism that exists in a solitary manner. It does not make friends, have multiple uses, or work together with other individuals. Option (A) is incorrect because amoebas do not have the ability to form social relationships. Option (B) is also incorrect because amoebas do not have multiple uses like a tool or resource. Option (C) is incorrect because amoebas do not engage in cooperative behaviors with other individuals.

This question requires basic knowledge about amoebas. Amoebas are single-celled organisms that exist as solitary individuals. Option (A) is incorrect because amoebas do not have the ability to make friends as they do not have complex social interactions. Option (B) is incorrect because amoebas do not have multiple uses in the way that humans might use an object or tool. Option (C) is incorrect because amoebas do not work together in a collective manner. The correct answer is option (D), which states that an amoeba exists as a solitary individual.
